creator: leguye@lifl.fr
text:
When an error is produced by the parsing of a .htaccess (in userdir), inside a
virtual host, it is logged into the general error_log. I noticed that when a '#'
was at the end of a line in the .htaccess file.

Can you please post the relevant part configuration? (bogus .htaccess file,
Userdir directives, particular VH config). The request headers would also be
helpful.

The 500 Error (?) was logged into the appropriate VH-access.log?

Thanks.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Pfffh. Right. Has nothing to do with userdir. (Only) this warning is not
assigned to the appropriate server log, because in the function
(ap_getword_conf) is no server information available.

Needs some further research how to solve this.
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
Apache HTTP Server 1.3.x is not supported anymore and no bugs will be fixed in the old codebase (cf. <http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/httpd-announce/201002.mbox/%3C20100203000334.GA19021@infiltrator.stdlib.net%3E>). Since this bug seems to affect only 1.3.x, I'm closing it as WONTFIX.

If this bug still affects you in a recent version (version 2.2.x or the upcoming version 2.4), please open a new bug.

Thank you for reporting the bug.
creator: mss@apache.org
